page.title: 13Ecology
page.content: Cornfields predominate in the centre of this territory which is rather flat apart from the shallow valley with a small stream on the west side.Areas of woodland are in the south and east, and Hungerford Common is on the northern boundary. The soil is not of the best and is reckoned Grade 2;the Common being only Grade 3. The woodlands are mostly of a pleasant mixture of hardwoods and the woods being private, offer a good refuge for wildlife, with minimal disturbance. A more obvious indication of conservation is the marking off with stakes of a length of road (Sanham Green Road) where the plant, Spiked Star of Bethelem, flourishes. The aim is that the plants will not be cut until after flowering, but the scheme often goes awry with changes in the personnel responsible for cutting.
